intro: Ditassa franciscoi, commonly known as the Francisco's spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes grass-like plants and flowering species. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white and purple. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
